name: py-pytest-runner
description: Invoke py.test as distutils command with dependency resolution.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools-scm
dependencies.description: The blessed package to manage your versions by scm tags.

dependent_to.name: py-ww
dependent_to.description: Wrappers for Python builtins with higher-level APIs.

dependent_to.name: py-kornia
dependent_to.description: Open Source Differentiable Computer Vision Library for PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-torch-cluster
dependent_to.description:
This package consists of a small extension library of highly optimized
graph cluster algorithms for the use in PyTorch.

dependent_to.name: py-pythran
dependent_to.description: Ahead of Time compiler for numeric kernels.

dependent_to.name: py-cfgrib
dependent_to.description:
Python interface to map GRIB files to the NetCDF Common Data Model
following the CF Convention using ecCodes.

dependent_to.name: py-datrie
dependent_to.description:
Super-fast, efficiently stored Trie for Python (2.x and 3.x). Uses
libdatrie.

dependent_to.name: py-grandalf
dependent_to.description:
Grandalf is a Python package made for experimentations with graph
drawing algorithms.

dependent_to.name: py-dictdiffer
dependent_to.description:
Dictdiffer is a helper module that helps you to diff and patch
dictionares.

dependent_to.name: py-cf-units
dependent_to.description:
Units of measure as required by the Climate and Forecast (CF) metadata
conventions.

dependent_to.name: py-torch-scatter
dependent_to.description:
This package consists of a small extension library of highly optimized
sparse update (scatter and segment) operations for the use in PyTorch,
which are missing in the main package.

dependent_to.name: py-onnx
dependent_to.description:
Open Neural Network Exchange (ONNX) is an open ecosystem that empowers
AI developers to choose the right tools as their project evolves. ONNX
provides an open source format for AI models, both deep learning and
traditional ML. It defines an extensible computation graph model, as
well as definitions of built-in operators and standard data types.
Currently we focus on the capabilities needed for inferencing (scoring).

dependent_to.name: py-intensity-normalization
dependent_to.description: Normalize intensities of images from various MRI modalities

dependent_to.name: py-qsymm
dependent_to.description:
Qsymm is a symmetry finder and symmetric Hamiltonian generator. It
automatically generates model Hamiltonians from symmetry constraints and
finds the full symmetry group of your Hamiltonian.

dependent_to.name: py-chardet
dependent_to.description: Universal encoding detector for Python 2 and 3

dependent_to.name: py-torch-geometric
dependent_to.description:
PyTorch Geometric (PyG) is a geometric deep learning extension library
for PyTorch. It consists of various methods for deep learning on graphs
and other irregular structures, also known as geometric deep learning,
from a variety of published papers. In addition, it consists of an easy-
to-use mini-batch loader for many small and single giant graphs, multi
gpu-support, a large number of common benchmark datasets (based on
simple interfaces to create your own), and helpful transforms, both for
learning on arbitrary graphs as well as on 3D meshes or point clouds.

dependent_to.name: py-torch-spline-conv
dependent_to.description:
This is a PyTorch implementation of the spline-based convolution
operator of SplineCNN.

dependent_to.name: py-kaldiio
dependent_to.description: A pure python module for reading and writing kaldi ark files

dependent_to.name: py-awkward0
dependent_to.description:
Manipulate arrays of complex data structures as easily as Numpy. Awkward
Array is a pure Python+Numpy library for manipulating complex data
structures as you would Numpy arrays.

dependent_to.name: py-gpustat
dependent_to.description: An utility to monitor NVIDIA GPU status and usage.

dependent_to.name: py-uproot3
dependent_to.description:
ROOT I/O in pure Python and Numpy. uproot is a reader and a writer of
the ROOT file format using only Python and Numpy. Unlike the standard
C++ ROOT implementation, uproot is only an I/O library, primarily
intended to stream data into machine learning libraries in Python.
Unlike PyROOT and root_numpy, uproot does not depend on C++ ROOT.
Instead, it uses Numpy to cast blocks of data from the ROOT file as
Numpy arrays.

dependent_to.name: py-audioread
dependent_to.description:
cross-library (GStreamer + Core Audio + MAD + FFmpeg) audio decoding for
Python.

dependent_to.name: py-spdlog
dependent_to.description:
The py-spdlog package provides a Python wrapper to the C++ spdlog
library.

dependent_to.name: py-overpy
dependent_to.description: A Python Wrapper to access the Overpass API.

dependent_to.name: py-neurokit2
dependent_to.description:
The Python Toolbox for Neurophysiological Signal Processing. This
package is the continuation of NeuroKit 1. It's a user-friendly package
providing easy access to advanced biosignal processing routines.
Researchers and clinicians without extensive knowledge of programming or
biomedical signal processing can analyze physiological data with only
two lines of code.

dependent_to.name: py-deepecho
dependent_to.description:
DeepEcho is a Synthetic Data Generation Python library for mixed-type,
multivariate time series.

dependent_to.name: py-omegaconf
dependent_to.description:
A hierarchical configuration system, with support for merging
configurations from multiple sources (YAML config files,
dataclasses/objects and CLI arguments) providing a consistent API
regardless of how the configuration was created.

dependent_to.name: py-torch-sparse
dependent_to.description:
This package consists of a small extension library of optimized sparse
matrix operations with autograd support.

dependent_to.name: py-pyinstrument
dependent_to.description: Call stack profiler for Python. Shows you why your code is slow!

dependent_to.name: py-hepdata-lib
dependent_to.description: Library for getting your data into HEPData
